properties.address: Gas Street St Luke's, Birmingham, Birmingham B15 2AT
properties.description: Colmore Coffee is a coffee shop operating out of Gas Street St Luke's Church. It's a warm, welcoming space with tables and chairs for anyone to sit at, whether you buy something or not. For a small fee children can have access to the soft play, and a mug of tea or coffee costs 50p. Love Your Neighbour run free activities during the week for example a craft club or a Ladies' Salsa class, Kids Matter course etc.
properties.title: Love Your Neighbour at Colmore Coffee, Birmingham

properties.address: Moor Pool Estate Office, Birmingham, West Midlands B17 9DY
properties.description: We warmly invite you for a hot drink and a biscuit (or two!) at our Carless Eco Centre (weather dependent) or Kenrick Room in the Moor Pool Estate Office on Wednesday mornings. The Carless Eco Centre is wheelchair accessible and has an accessible toilet. There is a steep slope down to the Estate Office and unfortunately this heritage building does not have an accessible toilet. Our volunteers will be working up at the Carless Eco Centre and you're welcome to join them in a spot of gardening or simply enjoy the peace and quiet with a cuppa.
properties.title: Moor Pool Warm Welcome

properties.address: Henley in Arden Baptist Church (The Baptist Church Hall), Henley in Arden, Warwickshire B95 5AU

properties.address: Northfield Baptist Church, 789 Bristol Road South, Northfield B31 2NQ
properties.description: NAF CAF is a pay-as-you-feel cafe providing hot healthy food, tea, coffee and soft drinks and free arts workshops each week. The cafe is family friendly and open to all. Food is served from 5pm, arts workshops are available all night and most weeks we run a choir from 6-7pm which all are welcome to join no matter their abilities. NAF CAF is a welcoming community of people who come together to socialise, meet new people and eat together. The cafe also collects surplus food from Aldi in Northfield each week that anyone who attends can take items from. From 4-5pm each person who comes along can take 3 items and after 5pm, anyone is welcome to take whatever else they may need. Bring your own carrier bags, there's always lots of fresh vegetables and shelf stables too.
properties.title: NAF CAF Community Cafe

properties.address: The Springfield Centre, Birmingham, West Midlands B13 9NY
properties.description: Place of Welcome” is typically attended by over 40 people each week, it is a much valued resource in the Sparkhill and Hall Green community for local people to come together for fellowship, food and social activities including cooking, knitting, crochet, board games and pool. The cooking group meets each Thursday at 12.30 to prepare and cook the hot meal together. If you would like to join this friendly group, then come to the Springfield Centre at 12 pm. Ingredients are provided and no experience is necessary. We welcome your ideas for recipes to try – we have enjoyed inspiring meals from all over the world. There is currently money and benefit advice, adult social care advice provided.
properties.title: Springfield Project Place of Welcome

properties.address: The Hub Hazelwell, Birmingham, West Midlands B14 7NH
properties.description: The Hub Hazelwell is a community building which runs a number of leisure and educational activities and provides room hire for local organisations. As part of our Warm Spaces initiative we are running a number of free or low cost activities, where people can come and learn a new skill or come and share a cuppa with neighbours. We offer various activities from a free drop-in digital space, exercise classes and a creative groups. Please contact the Hub to find out more.
properties.title: The Hub Hazelwell

properties.address: Bromsgrove Baptist Church, Bromsgrove, Worcestershire B60 2JD
properties.description: A warm space with a warm welcome. A place to come where it is OK not to be OK! A place where you can meet others, chat and do some activities (or not as you please!) There will be a jigsaw on the go, colouring to do, games to play and a prayer space and we will start with a brief time of prayer. There will be coffee and a light lunch such as soup and rolls or toasted sandwiches. Sometimes followed by dessert. All welcome.
properties.title: The Living Room

properties.address: Lil's Parlour CIC, West Midlands B31 3TG
properties.description: This space is a warm, inclusive space welcome to all when our larder is open - even those who are not members of our community larder. Join us for a warm welcome, a cuppa and a chat.
properties.title: The Living Room at Lil's Parlour CIC

properties.address: 216, Birmingham, West Midlands B13 9PQ
properties.description: At The Shires Retirement Village, we’ve cultivated a strong sense of community, with a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere at the heart of everything we do. You can meet friends for coffee or a bite to eat in our Bistro, enjoy a beer or cocktail in the Opal Bar, or participate in one of our afternoon guest speaker sessions. Relax with live music, join an exercise class, or take part in our Senior Citizens Clubs, including the Movie Club and Breakfast Club. There’s always something happening, and everyone is warmly invited to join in!
properties.title: The Shires

properties.address: Veolia Environmental Services, Birmingham, West Midlands B11 2BA
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 22nd January 2025** Pay a visit to the Tyseley Warm Welcome Space, and connect with the community over a cuppa! Open every Wednesday from 11am-2:30pm, everyone is welcome to pop in for hot drinks, food, activities, and a chat. Tyseley Warm Welcome Space is located at the Veolia Visitor Centre, James Road, Tyseley, B11 2BA. There is parking available on-site, or if you are taking public transport, it is a 10 minute walk from the Tyseley Train Station, and close to the X1, X2, 4 and 60 bus routes. You can even take a trip to the Community Reuse Shop located on our site, selling refurbished preloved items.
properties.title: Tyseley Warm Welcome Space
